meanings.def: a large round object in space that moves around a star (such as the sun) and receives light from it
examples: the planets of our solar system
the possibility of life deep below the planet's surface
He looked like something from another planet!
How many planets orbit the sun?
Hubble has found around 100 new extrasolar planets.
She believes there is life on other planets.
The spacecraft is currently in orbit around the red planet.
rocky planets like Venus and Mars
the outer planets of our solar system

meanings.def: used to mean ‘the world’, especially when talking about the environment
examples: the battle to save the planet
(informal, humorous) He must be one of the few people on the planet without a website.
Will recycling help save the planet?
We are destroying the planet with our fossil-fuel lifestyle.
I don't know a single other person on the planet who has seen this film.

meanings.def: used to suggest that somebody’s ideas are not realistic or practical
examples: He thinks being a father is easy. What planet is he on?

idioms.idiom: to be on another planet | what planet is somebody on?
idioms.def: used to suggest that somebody’s ideas are not realistic or practical
examples: He thinks being a father is easy. What planet is he on?
